Reviews.Title: “Better than i expected”
Reviews.Author: Dalibor11235
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel last weekend and we were utterly satisfied. It's extremely well located, just a couple of minutes walk from main Berlin S-Bahn route (it's the Noldnerplatz station); there are three pubs and a bakery/coffee place in the same street (in case you, as we did, decide to skip breakfast), closest "Spatkauf" is some 10 minutes away. The Room was very clean and spacious, equipped with a tv, a minifridge (came pretty handy as it was way too freezing outside :) and plenty of storage space. Toilet/shower facility was very neat too, small but clean and efficient and they even provided towels and toiletries. Free wi-fi had an excellent connection and the staff I spoke with seemed really pleasant. Overally I'd 100% recommend this hotel to student/low budget travellers, cause it's not fancy in any way but the price was EXTREMELY nice and there is nothing that would make you not like the hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good room, good links, lots of stairs”
Reviews.Author: weekender79
Reviews.Content: Simple room with ensuite, towels were changed, heating was warm, shower was fine, beds ok. Room was four floors up with no lift. Didn't try breakfast, instead bought juice and croissant for €2 at s bahn station on way into city centre. Get a 72hour abc zone travel ticket at airport for €24 and travel easily everywhere: trains, tram and bus.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, good value.”
Reviews.Author: CrystalWard
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for one night and it met my expectations. its clean, inexpensive and less than a 5 min. walk to the train. the neighborhood seems very quiet - i got a good night sleep. there were 2 shared bathrooms on my floor and they were both very clean. i never had to wait to use them. the free wi-fi didn't work very well.

Reviews.Title: “OK, near transition area, basic but large room.”
Reviews.Author: DrErsatz
Reviews.Content: A pension(apt/rooms that were remodeled and now rent out nightly) bit out in area that is improving. Large rooms, moderate(ikea-ish) furniture, small television, minifridge. Sharable bathroom is OK, our room had it's own which was clean and serviceable. WiFi. Rooms are on floors 2-5, up stairs. Near big weekend flea market, many cafes(east), 2 mass transit stations nearby. Street parking (with some luck). Skip breakfast. Best for backpackers, budget minded that don't mind a walk to the bahn.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel-Pension Victoria
HotelInfo.Address: Kaskelstr. 50, 10317 Berlin, Germany
